alert.note: Alert for Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 1:09PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Winds to 40 mph and pea sized hail will impact portions of Marion County through 200 PM EDT... At 108 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers near Speedway, or 8 miles northwest of Indianapolis, moving east at 25 mph. These showers are producing prolific pea sized hail. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beech Grove, Indianapolis and Lawrence. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 101 and 125. Interstate 69 between mile markers 200 and 201. Interstate 70 between mile markers 69 and 93. Interstate 74 between mile markers 71 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
